channel.title: Autodesk, Inc. JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [FF-1011] You can right click on the 3D canvas, and when you do, strange things happen
item.description:
You are able to right click on the 3D canvas, which I'm pretty sure is supposed to be disabled.

When you do it, it seems to act like you are panning around, especially when you click again to dismiss the context menu.
item.summary: You can right click on the 3D canvas, and when you do, strange things happen

item.title: [FF-1010] Translation error on a specific old classic DWF
item.description:
Translation failure for a classic DWF. May have some invalid content in the SVG.

DWF and screenshot attached.
item.summary: Translation error on a specific old classic DWF

item.title: [FF-1009] Translation error on a specific old classic DWF
item.description: Getting an error in the SVG, screenshot and DWF attached
item.summary: Translation error on a specific old classic DWF

item.title: [FF-1008] Mouse State gets lost
item.description: If you use the mouse double touch for right click touch on a mac laptop. You can lock your mouse state to "down" and thus permenantly pan.
item.summary: Mouse State gets lost

item.title: [FF-1007] Markup opposite anchor point
item.description: Create markup. Grab one corner of the markup and quickly invert the markup (take the corner and drag it across and beyond its opposite corner quickly). The opposite anchor moves in the opposite direction a little. With this method you can move your markup across the screen while only ever grabbing one corner of the markup.
item.summary: Markup opposite anchor point

item.title: [FF-1006] Zoom-rect rect is drawn behind markup
item.description: The dotted rect for the zoom-rect is drawn behind the markup.. I think it ought to be on top
item.summary: Zoom-rect rect is drawn behind markup

item.title: [FF-1005] Markup edits from mobile are overwritten by web
item.description: Create a markup on web, open that file on mobile and move the file. Now refresh the file on web, the markup is in the old position. Refresh the file on mobile its in the old position as well. This is caused by the web viewer saving over the new markup, not the mobile viewer not saving the change.
item.summary: Markup edits from mobile are overwritten by web

item.title: [FF-1004] Pressing delete/backspace button while markup selected doesn't delete markup
item.description: If you create a markup, and it is select and press the delete/backspace button on the keyboard (on a mac) the browser will execute a back page navigation instead of deleting the markup.
item.summary: Pressing delete/backspace button while markup selected doesn't delete markup

item.title: [FF-1003] Bad translation of file names
item.description: Uploaded "Stapler 2D.dwf" to Autodesk Cloud. Appears as "Stapler%202D.dwf" in mobile app.
item.summary: Bad translation of file names

item.title: [FF-1002] When a markup is inside another markup and the background one is selected, the inner markup isn't selectable until outer one is de-selected.
item.summary: When a markup is inside another markup and the background one is selected, the inner markup isn't selectable until outer one is de-selected.

item.title: [FF-1001] Tabs in markup do not display correctly upon leaving text edit mode
item.summary: Tabs in markup do not display correctly upon leaving text edit mode

item.title: [FF-1000] Callout line goes behind other markup regardless of the order markup items were created. This differs from Mobile.
item.summary: Callout line goes behind other markup regardless of the order markup items were created. This differs from Mobile.

item.title: [FF-998] Cursor is frequently invisible while editing markup
item.description:
When editing markup, the cursor/caret frequently disappears. Like, all the damn time.

Ian says it has something to do with the way the text box is being scaled. Regardless, this is Bad.
item.summary: Cursor is frequently invisible while editing markup

item.title: [FF-996] little text font doesn't render
item.description:
add a small text markup to a drawing (on mobile)

goto web and you'll find the text doesn't render
item.summary: little text font doesn't render

item.title: [FF-995] Missing Manifest Error on Mobile Confusing
item.description:
Trouble with translation produced several missing manifest errors on the web viewer. I decided to check this on the mobile device to see if it was erroring correctly. I relieved this message which seems not user-friendly.

This document could not be read due to an error. The error message is: Unknown presentation type "
item.summary: Missing Manifest Error on Mobile Confusing

item.title: [FF-994] You can click through the tab bar (Properties/Layers/etc) at the top, selecting the object below
item.description:
In Nitrous, you can click through the tab bar (Properties/Layers/etc) at the top. You will switch to that panel, and ALSO select the object below

Probably the same bug as clicking through the tool buttons, but lord knows i have no idea how to find old bugs in JIRA
item.summary: You can click through the tab bar (Properties/Layers/etc) at the top, selecting the object below

item.title: [FF-990] 2D document does not load in IE9 without Console open
item.description: 2d documents do not load in IE9 unless you have the debugging console open
item.summary: 2D document does not load in IE9 without Console open

item.title: [FF-989] Turning off layers does nothing. See attachment.
item.summary: Turning off layers does nothing. See attachment.

item.title: [FF-988] "Markup Selected" display doesn't go away when all markup is disabled. See attachment.
item.summary: "Markup Selected" display doesn't go away when all markup is disabled. See attachment.

item.title: [FF-987] Zoom to markup didn't zoom correctly
item.summary: Zoom to markup didn't zoom correctly

item.title: [FF-986] Selected Markup while it was off
item.description: If you create some markup, open the markup panel, Select it (so that you have the ability to resize it), and then in the markup panel turn off markup. You end up with this hanging UI that is unusable. Although if you play with it and then turn markup back on, everything is on fire.
item.summary: Selected Markup while it was off

item.title: [FF-985] Lastmarkup in markup panel does not retract
item.description: The last markup entry in a side panel with multiple markup cannot be retracted by hitting the "-" button. This seems to only occur when there are more than one markup. Can't confirm what action is with read only markup.
item.summary: Lastmarkup in markup panel does not retract

item.title: [FF-984] Selected markup resized itsef (error)
item.description: Select Markup | Turn off all markup from Markup panel | Change Markup background panel | Turn on Markup from Markup panel | Selected markup resized itsef (error)
item.summary: Selected markup resized itsef (error)

item.title: [FF-982] Markup Expand button disappears
item.description: The markup panel has expansion +/- Buttons. Everything starts expanded, but when I nu-expand them, the button disappears. I'm guessing because the - picture isn't in the preloading.
item.summary: Markup Expand button disappears

item.title: [FF-981] Selection color in 3D is affected by lighting
item.description: The green highlight color when you select something is affected by lighting- it probably shouldn't be. However, this is a pain to fix.
item.summary: Selection color in 3D is affected by lighting

item.title: [FF-980] Clicking on markup from panel sometimes goes to the wrong place
item.description:
I don't have a repro case, but here's all the stuff that I did:

  • I created about 10 simple markups on a DWF with no markups (Carriage 2D.dwf)
  • I played with the colors of one or two of the markups
  • I selected markups and then turned markup on and off from the panel
  • I deleted all but 4 of the markups

When clicking to zoom to a specific markup from the side panel, 1 of the 4 markups did not center on the markup, but rather the top left corner of the 2d diagram. I'm pretty sure that I moved the markup slightly and it still would zoom to the top left corner of the 2D drawing. Then, when Ian watched me, I moved the markup again and after that, the zoom to focus on the markup worked as expected.

Browser: Chrome / Mac
item.summary: Clicking on markup from panel sometimes goes to the wrong place

item.title: [FF-979] Markup Clipping sucks at small sizes
item.description: If you make a new markup and make it very small. The borders around the markup are HUGE and the clipping at the edges of the markup stay the same size as when they were big and so are also HUGE.
item.summary: Markup Clipping sucks at small sizes

item.title: [FF-978] Callout Markup needs an anchor.
item.description: By default, the callout markup styling should have a anchor attached to the pointer portion of it, even when not selected for editing. This should reflect the unselected color styling. Ask if there's questions about this.
item.summary: Callout Markup needs an anchor.

item.title: [FF-976] Lots o' Layer Problems
item.description:
On Shaver Complete - sheet 1

Layers panel is showing a "blank" layer (that doesn't seem to exist in ADR 2012) and when you toggle its visibility it crashes the viewer.

Other layers don't contain everything they should - Border for instance is missing the outter box border (the "blank" layer may contain all those things).

Visible Narrow layer is missing or not coming through.
item.summary: Lots o' Layer Problems

item.title: [FF-975] Whitespace in markup is not honored
item.summary: Whitespace in markup is not honored

item.title: [FF-974] Styling Update to Text Editing Mode in Markup
item.description: When editing a markup the user should experience a "lightbox" style effect of greying out the background to show which box the user has focus on. Also, a text cursor in the box to make it obvious that the user can enter text would be helpful. We should also keep the box highlighted in blue to show that it's in a selected, editable state, but remove the anchors to show that it can't be resized or repositioned.
item.summary: Styling Update to Text Editing Mode in Markup

item.title: [FF-973] Cannot open properties panel- button not working
item.description:
The text and image for the properties button are there (in Nitrous), but it is not clickable. The mouse cursor doesn't change (stays as an arrow) and you can't open the properties panel.

File is BlowerRaw.dwf
item.summary: Cannot open properties panel- button not working

item.title: [FF-972] If you have a markup selected, the tools and highlighted border remain when toggling markup off
item.summary: If you have a markup selected, the tools and highlighted border remain when toggling markup off

item.title: [FF-971] Color dialogs for markup should have titles
item.description: When you're editing the color of markup (either text, background or border), it's not clear which color you're editing. It should say something like, "Background Color" at the top or "Change Background Color". It would probably be good enough to just change "Pick a Color" to one of those.
item.summary: Color dialogs for markup should have titles

item.title: [FF-970] When you click a button on the tools panel, it ALSO clicks through the button and selects whatever object is behind it
item.description:
When you click a button on the tools panel, it ALSO clicks through the button and selects whatever object is behind it

Don't really have anything more to say about that.
item.summary: When you click a button on the tools panel, it ALSO clicks through the button and selects whatever object is behind it

item.title: [FF-969] Update deletion confirmation dialogue styling.
item.description: We should update the notification dialogue's styling. Most likely this will be solved with a different background color/stroke to match the notification styling rather than the error styling it has now. Also buttons could be scaled down.
item.summary: Update deletion confirmation dialogue styling.

item.title: [FF-968] No callout line in Safari
item.description: Callout markups don't display their actual callout lines in Safari. (The text box appears, but the line to the point coming out of the box is not there.)
item.summary: No callout line in Safari

item.title: [FF-967] Discrepancy in home view in ADR web vs ADR starting view 2012
item.description:
ArborPress.dwf

Home view is upside down in ADR web. In 2012, when you try to go to Starting View (ADR web uses this for home view) it starts to flip the model, but then forces it upright.

ADR 2012 may just not allow views to be upside down?
item.summary: Discrepancy in home view in ADR web vs ADR starting view 2012

item.title: [FF-966] Markup Editing Buttons Have Incorrect States
item.description: The buttons used to edit markup don't have an up/down/over state. The default state at the moment is also incorrect. I believe it's on the "down" state of the sprite currently.
item.summary: Markup Editing Buttons Have Incorrect States

item.title: [FF-964] Missing markup notification in workflow
item.description: We are missing a notification in the markup workflow. When the user selects the markup tool they should receive the same notification as they get on mobile telling them to click somewhere on the canvas to start adding whatever markup type they have selected. This could become repetitive on the desktop so we may consider adding a "Do not show again" checkbox on the notification.
item.summary: Missing markup notification in workflow

item.title: [FF-962] Creating Markup size is non-consistant
item.description: You're creating markup comparatively to the size of the page. Instead you should match the mobile project and make markup be based on the size of the screen.
item.summary: Creating Markup size is non-consistant

item.title: [FF-961] Zoom-in button sometimes resets zoom level
item.description:
Sometimes when I zoom in with the zoom button, when I push it, the zoom resets back to being zoomed out again. The point at which it happens is not consistent.

I am seeing this in building1.dwf with orthographic camera (default)
item.summary: Zoom-in button sometimes resets zoom level

item.title: [FF-960] zooming with 2 finger scroll on MacBook Pro too fast
item.description: the smallest quick tap to the 2 finger scroll results in gigantic amounts of zooming.
item.summary: zooming with 2 finger scroll on MacBook Pro too fast

item.title: [FF-959] Pre-existing markup lines are hard to see in FF (only tested FF)
item.summary: Pre-existing markup lines are hard to see in FF (only tested FF)

item.title: [FF-958] Styling Update: Viewer canvas color/tabs bar color
item.description: Nitrous changed their styling so we need to update ours. The background of the canvas needs to be changed to a lighter shade to better separate itself from the website's background. The tabs bar also is the wrong color. The white background should be changed to match the new grey of the website.
item.summary: Styling Update: Viewer canvas color/tabs bar color
